required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Study to Validate Comparability of an Infrared Thermographic Camera Versus Oral, Forehead, and Ear Thermometers When Determining Body Temperature in Adult Participants
clinical_study.official_title: Prospective, Observational, Single-Arm Study to Validate Comparability of an Infrared Thermographic Camera Versus Oral, Forehead, and Ear Thermometers When Determining Body Temperature in Anonymous Adult Participants

brief_summary.textblock: The primary objective of this study is to determine if the Infrared Cameras, Inc (ICI) FMX 400 infrared (IR) Class 1 infrared thermal camera (IRT) system is comparable to oral, forehead, and ear thermometers for determining human body temperature.

primary_outcome.measure: Infrared Thermal Camera (IRT) Calculated Human Body Temperature

arm_group.description: Participants will have their temperature collected by infrared thermal camera (IRT), oral, forehead, and ear thermometers.

intervention.intervention_name: Infrared Cameras Inc. (ICI) FMX 400 Infrared (IR) Camera System
Infrared Cameras Inc. (ICI) HotSpot Infrared (IR) NonContact Infrared Thermometer

study_pop.textblock: Adult participants entering the PRA Health Sciences - Early Development Services (PRA-EDS) Salt Lake City business location who agree to receive anonymous infrared thermal camera (IRT) Class 1 device temperature scan while undergoing routine temperature surveillance.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
1. Participants must be able to provide opt-out consent.
2. Participants must agree to have temperature recorded noninvasively using an infrared thermal camera (IRT) Class 1 device, oral thermometer, forehead thermometer, and ear thermometer.
Exclusion Criteria:
1. Participants who opt out of participating; ie, participants who do not agree to have temperature recorded noninvasively using an IRT Class 1 device, oral thermometer, forehead thermometer, and ear thermometer.
2. Participants who are not able to understand that their temperature will be recorded, or who are otherwise unwilling to participate.

facility.name: PRA Health Sciences - Early Development Services
